Details: Founder of the "Tsunik" company in Vitebsk, Belarus, between May and October 2005, Viktoryia TSUNIK, through forged false bills of lading sold 537,495 tons of stove fuel falsely labelled as diesel fuel, misappropriating about USD 130,000. In other similar cases, TSUNIK sold oil emulsion as stove fuel to three other companies, worth an estimated USD 15,000. TSUNIK was convicted and sentenced by Belarusian judicial authorities to serve a prison sentence. She speaks Russian and English.

Details of reason wanted for: Murder, Conspiracy to murder, drug trafficking, attempted murder

Details: CARROL is a member of the Quebec Nomads Chapter of the Hells Angels motorcycle club. He has been convicted of a number of offences in the past including assault, drug trafficking and firearms offences. The Hells Angels are a well structured criminal organization, and between 1995 and 2001 influenced the dealings of a number of organizations within the Montreal area. It was during this time that CARROL, along with two accomplices, allegedly conspired to murder members of rival motorcycle gangs Rock machines, Bandidos, Dark Cycle and Alliance. These gangs allegedly refused to obtain drug supplies from CARROL and the Hells Angels Nomads Chapter. CARROL is alleged to have been involved in the murder of 13 people and the attempted murder of 2 people. The Hells Angels have Chapters in more than 20 countries and information suggests that CARROL has frequented a number of countries including Brazil, Mexico, Australia, Europe, New Zealand, South Africa, United States and South America. Carrol speaks English and French.

In 2007 HOLLAND was employed as a Financial Director of the Sentula Mining company in South Africa. It is alleged that during 2008, HOLLAND siphoned away company money into an offshore account in Germany where HOLLAND was listed as the signatory. At around the time the accounting irregularities were discovered by the company, HOLLAND left South Africa, possibly for the United Kingdom.  HOLLAND has also been known to travel to the Netherlands and Australia. It is thought that he is currently located in one of these two countries.

Country believed to be in / Country of c: Bangladesh, Belgium, France, Italy, The Netherlands
Details: UDDIN is wanted in connection with the death of a young woman who was found with her throat cut in her apartment in Brussels in November 2002. The investigation established UDDIN as a suspect and a search of his house resulted in a pair of his shoes being matched to prints discovered at the crime scene. UDDIN is believed to be in Bangladesh or in Europe, possibly Belgium, France, Italy, or the Netherlands. It is thought that UDDIN visited Britain on 2002 using the alias Abdul Salam.
TAKO is wanted for the murder of one man and the attempted murder of another in April 1999 in Tirana, Albania for which he was sentenced to life imprisonment in October 1999 by Albanian authorities.
SIWEK is wanted in connection with the attempted murder in Poland in March 2004 of two individuals he attacked with a knife, leaving both with serious injuries.

As part of an investigation into a group involved in drug trafficking, of which SCHMITT was believed to be the leader, the police officers were travelling along the Guapore River and were shot at when their boat stopped to re-fuel.

It is also alleged that CRAIG forced the victims to perform sexual acts that were recorded for the purpose of being used in the trade of child abuse images. CRAIG was due before the courts in 1999 but failed to turn up at his hearing and has not been seen since. The quantity of the drugs smuggled could be used in the production of more than 16 million MDMA or ecstasy pills.

Details: In 2007 PROCHAZKA was employed by the security company GROUP 4 Securitas Cash Services CZ. On 1 December 2007 it is alleged that PROCHAZKA stole CZK 500, 1,000 and 2,000 banknotes from the company's safe in Prague. The total value of the money stolen was approximately CZK 500 million; or EUR 20 million. PROCHAZKA allegedly loaded the money into four metal cases and then carried them to a vehicle that was parked in the secure company grounds. The vehicle was being driven by a male accomplice. PROCHAZKA had earlier arranged access for the male and the vehicle into the company's grounds. After loading the money into the vehicle, it is alleged that the vehicle was driven out of the premises by PROCHAZKA's accomplice; and PROCHAZKA returned to his workplace where he stayed until the completion of his shift.  The vehicle used in the theft, a Volkswagen Transporter with licence plate 1L74973, has not been found. Police are appealing for information in relation to the vehicle during the time of the theft, and any recent sightings. PROCHAZKA speaks English and Czechoslovakian. He is known to have traveled to Mexico and Miami, America during 2007; and is also known to have links in Florida, America. It is also possible that he is still hiding somewhere within Europe. PROCHAZKA is known to alter his appearance, often changing between wearing a beard and moustache, to shaving his head bald. PROCHAZKA also alternates between wearing glasses and contact lenses. Caution: PROCHAZKA is considered violent and may be armed and dangerous

SONI is also wanted for his alleged involvement in the illegal distribution of alcohol across the UK. SONI was due to appear before the courts in May 2010, however he did not appear and it is believed that he fled to Europe. His current location is not known.

The 32-year-old Melbourne man is believed to be part of the syndicate which smuggled 138 kg of pure ice and 15 kg of cocaine concealed as a liquid in beer bottles imported from Mexico into Melbourne Port. As part of the operation which identified the syndicate and recovered the drugs, the Australian Federal Police also seized 13 firearms and arrested two males. SITAR is currently facing serious criminal charges relating to his involvement in this drug importation and the syndicate more broadly. He was last seen in Melbourne in October 2011.

The stolen car was found abandoned with false plates and in June 1994, the driver's body was found in a stream in Alcobendas, a town located on the northern outskirts of Madrid. The subsequent investigation by Spanish authorities established GUIBLI as the killer.

CLAMPARU and his associates organised papers and travel plans for the girls who had been offered "real" jobs, with the girls agreeing to refund the expenses from their wages. However, upon arrival in Spain it is alleged that they were beaten and forced to work as prostitutes to "repay" the transport costs. In 2004, 14 members of CLAMPARU's crime network were captured and tried. It is suspected that CLAMPARU is still involved in the trafficking of women from Romania to western European countries.

On the afternoon of 5 September, three armed and masked men entered the building and immediately shot and killed the two guards before threatening the six customers and 18 employees and escaping with around EUR 250,000 (1,800,000 Kunas). MORE and a number of accomplices travelled to a remote farmhouse in Cheshire where after their demands for money were refused, they assaulted the five people in the house, beating one so badly that he died at the scene. ELARMO used the name Daren Jones when initiating contact, however in 2004 he changed his name in the United States to Daren Michael ELARMO. Details: SIJAHAILATUA is suspected of attempting to kill a man in Amsterdam in the Netherlands on 10 August 2009. The victim was shot as he was sitting in his car and it is alleged that the suspects fired at the victim several times from a vehicle which was later found burnt out by police. It is alleged that between 1 April 2009 and 10 August 2009, SIJAHAILATUA, together with accomplices, made plans for the attack.

TERRY is wanted for his alleged involvement in the importation of 60kgs of heroin. Arrested in 2000 for attempting to bring heroin into the United Kingdom from France, TERRY fled the UK in 2001 during his trial. He was convicted in his absence and sentenced to 15 years. In the past TERRY has been known to travel to France, the Netherlands, Belgium and Spain however his current location is not known.

Wanted for: Murder, Violent crimes, Possession of firearms and/or explosives
Details of reason wanted for: Crimes against life and health, crimes involving the use of weapons/explosives
Details: Robert William Fisher is wanted for allegedly killing his wife and two young children and then blowing up the house in which they all lived in Scottsdale, Arizona in April of 2001. Fisher is physically fit and is an avid outdoorsman, hunter, and fisherman. He has a noticeable gold crown on his upper left first bicuspid tooth. He may walk with an exaggerated erect posture and his chest pushed out due to a lower back injury. Fisher is known to chew tobacco heavily. He has ties to New Mexico and Florida. Fisher is believed to be in possession of several weapons, including a high-powered rifle.

Details: He is involved in the kidnapping and murder Juan "Spark" Ortiz, in August 2009 in Ciudad del Este, Alto Paraná department. He is accused of being the gunman who took the life of "Spark".
SANABRIA is wanted for a robbery that resulted in murder on the 28 of November 2004, in  El Jagüel, Brazil.
Suspected for death of 4-year old girl in her care.

Examining magistrates investigating the Siemens kickbacks case on Wednesday issued arrest warrants for former Siemens Hellas executives Mihalis Christoforakos and Christos Karavelas. The warrants were issued chiefly as a formality in order to declare the investigation completed, appeals court sources said. The case concerns a contract signed in 1997 between the then state-run Greek telecoms company OTE and Siemens for the digitisation of OTE's switching centres. During an investigation into possible kickbacks paid to Greek state officials so that Siemens would be awarded state contracts, the magistrates found payments linked to the OTE contract in which the two former Siemens executives are implicated. In order to officially declare the end of the investigation on this aspect of the case, they therefore had to summons Christoforakos and Karavelas to testify and then issue arrest warrants. Both men are currently outside Greece, having fled in 2009 after they were summoned to testify. Karavelas is believed to be in Uruguay and Christoforakos, who had both Greek and German passports, fled to Germany and has remained there since a local court ruled, in November 2009, that under German law the statutes related to his offences have expired and he cannot be extradited to Greece to stand trial

In the early hours of 26 April 2004, MILIC and accomplices broke into a Megamarket store in Podgorica, Montenegro. They threated the guard with a gun before tying him up and then stealing more than EUR 30,000 in cash and cheques.
In May 2003, NIKCEVIC and others travelled to Skärholmen near Stockholm in Sweden where they are accused of a pre-mediated murder of a man who was later found shot to death.

In 1995 FOCO escaped from an Austrian jail where he was serving a life sentence for the fatal shooting of a prostitute in March 1982. A professional motorbike rider and former winner of the Austrian Motorbike Championship, during his imprisonment FOCO made regular accompanied trips to a University in Linz as part of his studies for a law degree. It was during one of these University day trips that FOCO escaped. A set of keys to a rented motorbike, a change of clothes and food had been left for him in a toilet block. He escaped with a black backpack and a sleeping bag.  Whilst in prison, FOCO built relationships with a number of women through correspondence and it is believed that FOCO persuaded one or more of these women to help him escape.  FOCO speaks English, French and Hungarian and is believed to have travelled to Hungary and also to the North Carolina and Florida areas of the United States. His current location is unknown.
